qas.question: Along with Guam, which other territories were in the United States jurisdiction before WWII?

answers.text: American Samoa, Hawaii, and the Philippines

qas.question: What was the date on the attack of Pearl Harbor?
What happened just after the attack on Peal Harbor?

answers.text: Guam was captured by the Japanese

qas.question: How long did the Japanese occupation last?
In what year did the US acquire American Samoa?
In what year did the US acquire the Philippines?
In what year did the United States Armed Forces establish their first base on Guam?
On what date did World War II start?

context: Before World War II, Guam and three other territories – <a0_0>American Samoa, Hawaii, and the Philippines<a0_0/> – were the only American jurisdictions in the Pacific Ocean. On <a1_0><b7_0>December 7, <b4_0><b5_0>1941<b7_0/><b5_0/><b4_0/><a1_0/>, hours after the attack on Pearl Harbor, <a2_0>Guam was captured by the Japanese<a2_0/>, and was occupied for <a3_0>thirty months<a3_0/>. During the occupation, Guamanians were subjected to culture alignment, forced labor, beheadings, rape, and torture. Guam endured hostilities when American forces recaptured the island on July 21, <b6_0>1944<b6_0/>; Liberation Day commemorates the victory. Since the 1960s, the economy is supported by two industries: tourism and the United States Armed Forces.
